question: 何日
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>What</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji> equals the fairly obvious translation "<vocabulary>what day</vocabulary>." But, it also means <vocabulary>how many days</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji, but <ja>何</ja> actually uses the kun'yomi reading here! And since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember this reading:

<vocabulary>How many days</vocabulary> does it take you to bake a <reading>naan</reading> <reading>Nietzsche</reading> (<ja>なんにち</ja>)? It's not easy to make a Nietzsche entirely out of naan, so I wonder how many days it would take.
